thread.title: Jeju Braces for Torrential Downpour: 300mm of Rain and Gusty Winds to Hit Island, South Coast to See 100mm Deluge
thread.title_full: Jeju Braces for Torrential Downpour: 300mm of Rain and Gusty Winds to Hit Island, South Coast to See 100mm Deluge

author: newsdirectory3
title: Jeju Braces for Torrential Downpour: 300mm of Rain and Gusty Winds to Hit Island, South Coast to See 100mm Deluge
text:
Typhoon Konglei Brings Heavy Rain and⁢ Strong Winds ⁢to‌ Jeju Island Strong rain and wind are hitting the southern‍ coast of ‌Jeju Island, with⁢ a ⁢heavy rain and strong wind ⁤warning issued for ⁣the area. Water vapor⁤ is⁤ flowing⁤ in, forming rain clouds and bringing heavy precipitation ‌to the region.
Typhoon Konglei, which struck⁤ Taiwan, is currently moving along the southern coast of ‌China with⁢ its strength weakening. ​The typhoon is expected to weaken to a low-pressure system⁣ offshore overnight, ⁢and remaining rain ​clouds are ‌expected to affect Korea as well.
Jeju Island and Southern‌ Region Affected Rain clouds are forming in Jeju Island⁣ and the southern ‍region as‍ water vapor flows in​ from the⁤ front of the typhoon. Although the rain clouds left by the typhoon ⁤have not ‌yet flowed in⁣ in earnest, the amount of precipitation per hour is gradually increasing.
Heavy rain of 30 to 50 mm per hour is ⁢expected in the mountains of Jeju⁣ between this afternoon and​ early morning tomorrow. ⁤A heavy rain warning and‍ a strong wind ‌warning have been issued for the mountains ‌of Jeju, and a wind⁣ warning is being ‍issued focusing on the southern ⁢seas.
Weather Forecast Heavy ⁢rain of up⁢ to 300 mm⁤ or more​ will fall in ⁢the ⁣mountains of Jeju Island until tomorrow ‍morning. Heavy rain of up⁢ to 100 mm or more ‍is⁢ expected in the​ southern coast of Gyeongnam, including the southern‍ coast of Jeollanam-do and‍ Busan.
Strong ⁣winds of⁢ around 25 ⁣meters ‌per second will blow‌ in Jeju Island and the southern coast, and high ⁢waves will ‌rise ‍at sea. ​There is a possibility of flight delays or cancellations on Jeju Island, and coastal areas with strong rain and wind⁣ will need to be careful about safety accidents until tomorrow morning.
Stay Safe and Informed Stay tuned​ for updates on the weather ⁢forecast and ⁣warnings. Take necessary ⁢precautions‌ to ensure‍ your safety and the ​safety ‌of those around you.
